arts.ttl: Arsenal look to Champions League rivals for back up to David Raya
arts.sum: There’s no doubt that David Raya remains Arsenal’s No.1 under Mikel Arteta, but the Gunners are still searching for decent back-up for the Spanish custodian. That’s not to suggest that Neto isn’t good enough to cover his contemporary, however, it’s known that his tenure at the Emirates Stadium is only expected to be temporary. When […] The post Arsenal look to Champions League rivals for back up to David Raya appeared first on CaughtOffside.

arts.ttl: Arteta fears for Calafiori, Saka before L'pool clash
arts.sum: Mikel Arteta fears Riccardo Calafiori could join Arsenal's mounting injury list but vowed the Gunners "will be flying" against Liverpool on Sunday.

arts.ttl: Mykhailo Mudryk spotted at the Emirates for Arsenal vs Shakhtar and the jokes write themselves…
arts.sum: Chelsea star Mykhailo Mudryk was spotted at the Arsenal game against Shakhtar Donetsk at the Emirates Stadium last night, and his presence has caused quite a stir online. Mudryk notably came close to joining Arsenal before ending up at Stamford Bridge instead as Chelsea hijacked the deal to bring him in from Shakhtar. It was […] The post Mykhailo Mudryk spotted at the Emirates for Arsenal vs Shakhtar and the jokes write themselves… appeared first on CaughtOffside.

arts.ttl: 'Believe me': Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta sends defiant message to Liverpool ahead of Sunday's big clash at N5
arts.sum: Arsenal have a huge Premier League fixture ahead of them this Sunday as high-flying Liverpool come to the Emirates Stadium. Mikel Arteta’s Gunners and Arne...

arts.ttl: Mikel Arteta drops biggest hint yet that Bukayo Saka will miss Arsenal vs Liverpool
arts.sum: Arsenal star Bukayo Saka has missed Arsenal's last two matches in the Premier League and Champions League through injury and faces a race against time to be fit for Sunday

arts.ttl: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta provides 'worried' Riccardo Calafiori injury update
arts.sum: Riccardo Calafiori limped off in Arsenal's Champions League win over Shakhtar Donetsk and Gunners boss Mikel Arteta is concerned about the defender ahead of Sunday's clash with Liverpool

arts.ttl: Arsenal 'target' £75m Premier League striker amid honest transfer admission
arts.sum: football.london says: Arsenal were heavily linked with signing a striker during the summer, and it would come as no surprise if the position is still an area in need of strengthening ahead of the New Year. football.london says: Kimmich was tentatively linked with a move to Arsenal during the summer, but the majority of the reports have always suggested that Barcelona would be his most likely destination if he was to leave Bayern.

arts.ttl: Arsenal 1-0 Shakhtar Donetsk: Player ratings as wasteful Gunners secure nervy win
arts.sum: Leandro Trossard missed a penalty after the restart as Shakhtar threatened to stun the hosts with a late leveller, but the Gunners held on to secure an important win before Sunday's Premier League battle with Liverpool. The Gunners found themselves ahead at half-time thanks to a slice of luck following Shakhtar goalkeeper Dmytro Riznyk's own goal and they could have extended their lead before the break had it not been for some wasteful finishing.

arts.ttl: Erling Haaland may ruin Arsenal transfer plan as major twist comes to light
arts.sum: Manchester City star Erling Haaland is being targeted by Real Madrid and Sporting striker Viktor Gyokeres has been linked with a move to the Etihad to replace the Norwegian

arts.ttl: Arsenal and Chelsea on red alert as John Henry and FSG make clever £325m Liverpool decision
arts.sum: The decision by Liverpool's owners Fenway Sports Group and principal owner John Henry is expected to bring the Merseyside club's kit earnings into line with Arsenal, Manchester City and Chelsea, who all receive about £60million-£65million from deals with Adidas, Puma and Nike respectively, The Guardian reports. Arsenal's kit contract with Adidas runs until 2030 and is said to be worth around £600million.
